amendment.description: To ensure that Social Security surpluses are not raided in order to fund tax cuts on corporate dividends.

action.text: Amendment SA 560 ruled out of order by the chair.
Motion to waive the Budget Act with respect to amendment SA 560 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 44 - 53. Record Vote Number: 147.
Point of order raised in Senate with respect to amendment SA 560.
Amendment SA 560 proposed by Senator Reid. (consideration: CR S6164-6174; text: CR S6164) To ensure that Social Security surpluses are not raided in order to fund tax cuts on corporate dividends.
Roll call votes on amendments in Senate: Motion to waive the Budget Act with respect to amendment SA 560 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 44 - 53. Record Vote Number: 147.
Senate amendment proposed (on the floor): Amendment SA 560 proposed by Senator Reid.
